trans-unit.source: Determines whether the current process is elevated

seg-source.mrk: Determines whether the current process is elevated

target.mrk: Determines whether the current process is elevated

trans-unit.source: True - The current process is elevated.

seg-source.mrk: True - The current process is elevated.

target.mrk: True - The current process is elevated.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, the function always sets the @extended flag to one of the following values (any other value

seg-source.mrk: Additionally, the function always sets the @extended flag to one of the following values (any other value

target.mrk: Additionally, the function always sets the @extended flag to one of the following values (any other value

trans-unit.source: 0 - Indicates that either the User Account Control (UAC) is disabled, or the process is started by a standard

seg-source.mrk: 0 - Indicates that either the User Account Control (UAC) is disabled, or the process is started by a standard

target.mrk: 0 - Indicates that either the User Account Control (UAC) is disabled, or the process is started by a standard

trans-unit.source: user (not a member of the Administrators group).

seg-source.mrk: user (not a member of the Administrators group).

target.mrk: user (not a member of the Administrators group).

trans-unit.source: The following two values can be returned only if both the UAC is enabled and the user is a member

seg-source.mrk: The following two values can be returned only if both the UAC is enabled and the user is a member

target.mrk: The following two values can be returned only if both the UAC is enabled and the user is a member

trans-unit.source: of the Administrators group (that is, the user has a "split" token).

seg-source.mrk: of the Administrators group (that is, the user has a "split" token).

target.mrk: of the Administrators group (that is, the user has a "split" token).

trans-unit.source: 1 - Indicates that the process is running elevated.

seg-source.mrk: 1 - Indicates that the process is running elevated.

target.mrk: 1 - Indicates that the process is running elevated.

trans-unit.source: 2 - Indicates that the process is not running elevated.

seg-source.mrk: 2 - Indicates that the process is not running elevated.

target.mrk: 2 - Indicates that the process is not running elevated.

trans-unit.source: This function requires Windows Vista or later.

seg-source.mrk: This function requires Windows Vista or later.

target.mrk: This function requires Windows Vista or later.
